parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To persuade, incite, seduce, tempt. From ana and peitho; to incite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To reverence, worship, adore. Middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to revere, i.e. Adore.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
